result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Raymond Elvetici was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs remitted.
***Per Court, credit for 108 days on count 1, not count 4.
Concurrent with: count 2
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently being served

superMiscConds.notes: Up to 25% to be paid from prison monies, work out payment plan with agent.

Obtain GED or HSED.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample on 3-24-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

Absolutely no contact with T.E., neither directly or indirectly.
Absolutely no contact with any known drug users, drug dealers or anyone known to possess illegal drugs, or who has prior drug convictions, neither directly or indirectly.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol, drugs or drug paraphernalia unless prescribed by a qualified and licensed medical professional and only to take prescription medications as prescribed.
May not be in any establishment that serves open alcohol, or whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.

AODA assessment, treatment and follow through.
Complete any treatment recommended by agent and/or through COMPAS assessment.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence currently being served

Costs remitted.
Concurrent with: count 2.
Consecutive to count 1.
